TopicTitle: The funniest thing just happened to me

Articles.Content: I was deorbiting my landing craft on auto-pilot with a MechJeb and just when I think we\'re about to safely land with 50 meters to go it completely runs out of fuel and smashes into the ground.

I was deorbiting my landing craft on auto-pilot with a MechJeb and just when I think we\'re about to safely land with 50 meters to go it completely runs out of fuel and smashes into the ground.

Welcome to the forums. It\'s annoying when that happens -- all I can suggest is starting firing the engines late in descent, especially in an atmosphere. Granted, it\'s easy to crash into terrain at hundreds of m/s that way (especially on the mun)... >_>

@augerman: Please have posts that consist of more than image macros/reaction images? =/

I was deorbiting my landing craft on auto-pilot with a MechJeb and just when I think we\'re about to safely land with 50 meters to go it completely runs out of fuel and smashes into the ground.

Well I just hate it when that happens. Because of situations like this, I actually crash more often with autopilot, than if I\'m piloting manually. It\'s easy to have a false sense of security, but in reality there are more things to keep track of, all changing more quickly.
Serves you right for trusting a computer. The best missions are flown with nothing but the steel nerves and raw skill of their kerbals.

Awesome!
